pages.text: Radiation is a dangerous force that must be carefully monitored. The Radiation Detector is your primary tool for measuring radiation levels in your environment. Right-click with the detector to measure current radiation levels.
The Radiation Detector is crafted using lead ingots for shielding, redstone for detection, and glass for the display.

pages.title: Understanding Readings
pages.text: Radiation levels are measured in mSv/h (millisieverts per hour):$(br2)• 0-1 mSv/h: Safe$(br)• 1-5 mSv/h: Caution$(br)• 5+ mSv/h: Dangerous$(br2)Extended exposure to radiation will cause health effects and can be fatal.

pages.title: Protection
pages.text: Lead blocks provide excellent radiation shielding. Each lead block reduces radiation by 50%. Place lead blocks between yourself and radiation sources for protection.$(br2)Always carry a radiation detector and lead blocks when working with nuclear materials!
